structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS
GENERAL PROVISIONS APPLICABLE TO COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS

law.catch_line: Procedure for establishing or changing rates or charges for service.

text.section: The rates and charges to be assessed by the commission to its member entities and other parties shall be the verified cost of providing the services as prescribed in this section, and shall be allocated based on usage and the cost of service. However, if continuity of consumer service or the preservation of water quality is threatened by special circumstances affecting a public wastewater utility, the commission may establish special rates for that entity for a period not to exceed one (1) year so long as benefits to member entities are not jeopardized and nonmembers are not adversely affected in any manner.

The commission shall establish wholesale charges, rates, and terms for its services to its member entities and to any other party to which it provides service under contract that are fair, just, and reasonable and shall be sufficient at all times to:
Pay the cost of operation and maintenance of any facility that it may own or lease to provide wastewater services contracted to its member entities or other parties;
Pay the principal and interest on any bonds, loans, or other instruments or obligations secured in the name of the commission; and
Provide an adequate fund for renewals, replacements, and reserves.

law.history: Created 2011 Ky. Acts ch.98, sec.11, effective June 8, 2011.
